Japanese Invasion History and Heritage

Japanese Invasion Series

Sungei Buloh Wetland Reserve

The landing site of the Japanese Imperial Guards Division on 9 February 1942, now a world-class eco-tourism experience.

Labrador Park

The site of the Labrador Battery and the coastal guns, alongside Singapore's oldest docks.

Sentosa

The site of Fort Siloso.

Kent Ridge-Bukit Chandu

The battleground of Lieutenant Adnan Saidi's fight to the death and the Former Ford Factory where the British surrendered.

Bukit Batok Nature Park

Japanese WWII Memorial Plaque, Quarry.

MacRitchie Reservoir

Lim Bo Seng's grave; "Syonan Jinja" Light of the South Shrine.
